==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}

===Etymology===
* From [[古]] ‘ancient’ + [[琴]] ‘stringed instrument’

===Pronunciation===
{{zh-pron
|m=gǔqín
|c=gu2 kam4
|ma=zh-gu3qin2.ogg
|cat=n,pn
}}

===Noun===
[[Image:Lian Zhu Shi.jpg|thumb|120px|An antique ''guqin'' in the ''lianzhu'' form]]
{{zh-noun}}

# {{lb|zh|music}} [[guqin]]; Chinese seven-stringed zither, [[qin]]
#: {{zh-x|彈{tán} 古琴|to play the ''guqin''}}

====Usage notes====
* In the past, the {{lang|zh|古琴}} was referred to only as {{zh-l|琴}}, but it now has the prefix {{m|zh|古|古-|ancient}} to distinguish it from other instruments which also use the word {{zh-l|琴}}. The {{lang|zh|古琴}} may be referred to as {{zh-l|琴}} after the first mention of {{lang|zh|古琴}}.
* It is sometimes confused with the [[guzheng]] ({{zh-l|古箏|tr=-}}) which is a different stringed instrument.

====Synonyms====
* {{zh-l|琴}}
* {{zh-l|七絃琴}}, {{zh-l|七弦琴|tr=qīxiánqín}}

====Derived terms====
{{zh-der|古琴譜|古琴曲|古琴室}}
